p: Clonorchis sinensis infection is acquired by the ingestion of contaminated seafood. The clinical features are those of fever, abdominal pain, and diarrhea. On physical exam a tender hepatomegaly is appreciated. Biliary obstruction and stone formation may also occur. There may be recurrent pyogenic cholangitis and cholangiocarcinoma may arise. The diagnosis is by the detection of characteristic eggs in the stool or the identification of the flukes in the bile ducts or gallbladder. Treatment is with praziquantel [ 59â€“ 64].
